Properties.ProtectedString:
local Tool = script.Parent;
local stillEquipped = true function onEquippedLocal(mouse) stillEquipped = true if mouse == nil then print("Mouse not found") return end
while stillEquipped do print("Setting Mouse to Go") mouse.Icon = "rbxasset://textures\\GunCursor.png"
while Tool.Enabled and stillEquipped do wait(.01) end
print("Setting Mouse To Wait") mouse.Icon = "rbxasset://textures\\GunWaitCursor.png"
while not Tool.Enabled and stillEquipped do wait(.01) end end end
function onUnequippedLocal() stillEquipped = false end
Tool.Equipped:connect(onEquippedLocal) Tool.Unequipped:connect(onUnequippedLocal)

-- Script for eel sword, based on Mahjong Sword's example code.
-- Game service, which allows us to get the time local runServ = game:service("RunService")
-- For eel sword stab is presumably more powerful than slash, since it lets the eel shock! -- (Also it takes way more time due to our double-click detection difficulties.) -- So damage values will be adjusted accordingly.
local TOUCH_DAMAGE = 5 -- Touch damage... local SLASH_DAMAGE = 8 -- Slash damage... local STAB_DAMAGE = 12 -- ... and stab damage. local damage = TOUCH_DAMAGE -- The CURRENT damage, set to one of the three below
-- Getting the tool and its handle: local sword = script.Parent.Handle local tool = script.Parent
-- Variables for the animations local slashAnim local stabAnim
-- Particle effects! local sparkles = Instance.new("Sparkles") sparkles.SparkleColor = Color3.new(1, 1, 35/255) local fire = Instance.new("Fire") fire.Color = Color3.new(1, 1, 35/255) fire.SecondaryColor = Color3.new(1, 1, 1) fire.Size = 3
-- Using same sounds as Sorcus's Sword of Judgment, because I can local slashSound = Instance.new("Sound") slashSound.SoundId = "rbxasset://sounds\\swordslash.wav" slashSound.Parent = sword slashSound.Volume = 0.7
local stabSound = tool:FindFirstChild("EelSound")
local unsheathSound = Instance.new("Sound") unsheathSound.SoundId = "rbxasset://sounds\\unsheath.wav" unsheathSound.Parent = sword unsheathSound.Volume = 0.5
-- blow: calculates and applies the damage form an attack or touch function blow(hit) if hit == nil or hit.Parent == nil then return end
-- Set up local variables for "my" character (the one holding this eel sword) and the "other" one (the one I'm hitting with it) local myCharacter = tool.Parent local myPlayer = game.Players:playerFromCharacter(vCharacter) local myHum = myCharacter:findFirstChild("Humanoid") local otherHum = hit.Parent:findFirstChild("Humanoid")
-- Check to make sure everything's non-nil, and that the sword is actually in "my" right hand (so it hasn't been chopped off) -- Also check to make sure I'm not damaging myself. if myHum ~= nil and myHum ~= otherHum and otherHum ~= nil then local rightArm = myCharacter:findFirstChild("Right Arm") if rightArm ~= nil then local joint = rightArm:findFirstChild("RightGrip") if joint ~= nil and (joint.Part0 == sword or joint.Part1 == sword) then tagHumanoid(otherHum, myPlayer) otherHum:TakeDamage(damage) wait(1) untagHumanoid(otherHum) end end end end
-- tagHumanoid and untagHumanoid: For leaderboard functionality (?) function tagHumanoid(humanoid, player) local creatorTag = Instance.new("ObjectValue") creatorTag.Value = player creatorTag.Name = "creator" creatorTag.Parent = humanoid end
function untagHumanoid(humanoid) if humanoid ~= nil then local tag = humanoid:findFirstChild("creator") if tag ~= nil then tag.Parent = nil end end end
-- slash: slash attack function slash() damage = SLASH_DAMAGE if slashSound then slashSound:Play() end end
-- stab: stab attack
function stab() damage = STAB_DAMAGE if stabSound then stabSound:Play() end -- rotate the sword; copied and pasted from Mahjong Sword's example for i = 1, 5 do -- These are the angles we need to rotate the sword by as the animation plays phi = (i*math.pi/10) theta = -i *math.pi/30 psi = i *math.pi/20 + math.pi tool.GripForward = Vector3.new(math.cos(theta) * math.cos(phi), - math.cos(psi) * math.cos(phi) + math.sin(phi) * math.sin(theta) * math.cos(psi), math.sin(phi) * math.sin(psi) + math.cos(phi) * math.sin(theta) * math.cos(psi)) tool.GripRight = Vector3.new(math.sin(psi) * math.cos(theta), math.cos(phi) * math.cos(psi) + math.sin(psi)* math.sin(theta) * math.sin(phi), - math.sin(phi) * math.cos(psi) + math.cos(phi) * math.sin(theta) * math.sin(psi)) tool.GripUp = Vector3.new(-math.sin(theta), math.sin(phi) * math.cos(theta), math.cos(theta) * math.cos(phi)) wait(.1) end wait(2) --Reset the sword back to its original Orientation -- Try to rotate it back smoothly. for i = 1, 10 do phi = math.pi/2 - i*math.pi/20 theta = (math.pi/3 + i*math.pi/30) psi = 5*math.pi/4 - i *math.pi/40 tool.GripForward = Vector3.new(math.cos(theta) * math.cos(phi), - math.cos(psi) * math.cos(phi) + math.sin(phi) * math.sin(theta) * math.cos(psi), math.sin(phi) * math.sin(psi) + math.cos(phi) * math.sin(theta) * math.cos(psi)) tool.GripRight = Vector3.new(math.sin(psi) * math.cos(theta), math.cos(phi) * math.cos(psi) + math.sin(psi)* math.sin(theta) * math.sin(phi), - math.sin(phi) * math.cos(psi) + math.cos(phi) * math.sin(theta) * math.sin(psi)) tool.GripUp = Vector3.new(-math.sin(theta), math.sin(phi) * math.cos(theta), math.cos(theta) * math.cos(phi)) wait(.02) end -- Just in case, manually set it back. tool.GripForward = Vector3.new(0.0 -1.0, 0.0) tool.GripRight = Vector3.new(-1.0, 0.0, 0.0) tool.GripUp = Vector3.new(0.0, 0.0, 1.0) -- Reset the damage damage = TOUCH_DAMAGE end
-- Tentative lock (?) tool.Enabled = true local lastAttack = 0
-- onActivated: function that gets called when sword is activated function onActivated() -- Check that tool is enabled if (not tool.Enabled) then return end
-- Then disable it, so it can't be used again immediately tool.Enabled = false
-- Checks to make sure player and humanoid are still available local myCharacter = tool.Parent if (myCharacter == nil) then return end local myHumanoid = myCharacter:findFirstChild("Humanoid") if (myHumanoid == nil) then return end
-- Time between attacks... local t = runServ.Stepped:wait()
-- If there was a very short time between this click and the last one, it was a double click, so STAB! if (t - lastAttack < 0.2) then -- End slash sound/animation that will have started (less than .2 seconds ago) if slashSound then slashSound:Stop() end if slashAnim then slashAnim:Stop() end
-- Then play the stab animation... stabAnim = myHumanoid:LoadAnimation(tool.Stab) if stabAnim then stabAnim:Play() end -- ... shock... shock() -- ... and actually stab. stab() -- Wait a little while, wait(.3) -- remove the shock, removeShock() -- and wait enough time for the animation (2.5 s) to finish. wait(.2) else -- If it's been a longish time since the last click, it was a single click, so SLASH! -- Stop the stab sound, just in case? if stabSound then stabSound:Stop() end
-- Load and play the slash animation... slashAnim = myHumanoid:LoadAnimation(tool.FastSlash) if slashAnim then slashAnim:Play() end -- ... and actually slash. slash() end
-- Update the time lastAttack = t -- And re-enable the tool. tool.Enabled = true end
function onEquipped() -- Fix position of sword if necessary tool.GripForward = Vector3.new(0.0 -1.0, 0.0) tool.GripRight = Vector3.new(-1.0, 0.0, 0.0) tool.GripUp = Vector3.new(0.0, 0.0, 1.0) -- Unmute unsheath... unsheathSound.Volume = 0.5 -- Play the unsheath sound, stop other sounds. if unsheathSound then unsheathSound:Play() end if stabSound then stabSound:Stop() end if slashSound then slashSound:Stop() end -- And stop the shock effect, just in case removeShock() end
function onUnequipped() -- Stop any sounds and animations if stabAnim then stabAnim:Stop() end if slashAnim then slashAnim:Stop() end if stabSound then print ("Stopping") stabSound:Stop() end
if slashSound then slashSound:Stop() end if unsheathSound then unsheathSound:Stop() end -- And stop the shock effect, just in case removeShock() end
-- shock: Creates a non-damaging shock effect using fire and sparkles particles. function shock() sparkles.Parent = sword fire.Parent = sword end
-- removeShock: gets rid of the effects created by shock. function removeShock() if sparkles then sparkles.Parent = nil end if fire then fire.Parent = nil end end
tool.Activated:connect(onActivated) tool.Equipped:connect(onEquipped) tool.Unequipped:connect(onUnequipped)
connection = sword.Touched:connect(blow)
